slides.title: Welcome to Environmental Processes
slides.content:
# Introduction to Environmental Processes

Welcome to **Environmental Processes** - how Earth's surface changes!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Weathering** - Breaking down rocks
- **Erosion** - Moving sediment
- **Water Cycle** - Global water movement
- **Soil Formation** - Creating earth

> **Fun Fact:** The Grand Canyon was carved over 5-6 million years!

slides.title: Weathering
slides.content:
# Weathering

## Physical Weathering:
Breaking rock without changing composition.

| Type | Mechanism |
|------|----------|
| Frost wedging | Water freezes, expands |
| Root growth | Plants split rock |
| Thermal expansion | Heating/cooling |
| Abrasion | Particles grind rock |

## Chemical Weathering:
Changing rock's chemical structure.

| Type | Mechanism |
|------|----------|
| Oxidation | Reaction with O2 |
| Hydrolysis | Reaction with H2O |
| Carbonation | Reaction with CO2 |
| Acid rain | Dissolves limestone |

## Biological Weathering:
- Organisms produce acids
- Lichens on rocks
- Burrowing animals

slides.title: Erosion and Deposition
slides.content:
# Erosion and Deposition

## Agents of Erosion:

| Agent | Features Created |
|-------|----------------|
| Water | Valleys, canyons, deltas |
| Wind | Dunes, desert polishing |
| Glaciers | U-valleys, moraines |
| Waves | Beaches, sea cliffs |
| Gravity | Landslides, rockfalls |

## River Erosion:
- Headward erosion
- Downcutting
- Lateral erosion
- Creates V-shaped valleys

## Deposition:
- When energy decreases
- Larger particles drop first
- Deltas, alluvial fans

## Glacial Erosion:
- Plucking and abrasion
- U-shaped valleys
- Cirques, aretes, horns

slides.title: The Water Cycle
slides.content:
# The Water Cycle

## Processes:

| Process | Description |
|---------|------------|
| Evaporation | Water to vapor |
| Transpiration | Plants release water |
| Condensation | Vapor to water |
| Precipitation | Rain, snow, sleet |
| Runoff | Surface water flow |
| Infiltration | Water enters ground |

## Reservoirs:

| Reservoir | Percentage |
|-----------|------------|
| Oceans | 97.5% |
| Ice/Glaciers | 1.7% |
| Groundwater | 0.8% |
| Lakes/Rivers | 0.01% |
| Atmosphere | 0.001% |

## Groundwater:
- Aquifer: Water-bearing rock
- Water table: Top of saturated zone
- Recharge: Water entering aquifer

slides.title: Soil Formation
slides.content:
# Soil Formation

## Soil Composition:
- Minerals (45%)
- Organic matter (5%)
- Air (25%)
- Water (25%)

## Soil Horizons:

| Horizon | Layer |
|---------|-------|
| O | Organic, leaf litter |
| A | Topsoil, humus |
| E | Leached, pale |
| B | Subsoil, accumulation |
| C | Weathered parent material |
| R | Bedrock |

## Soil Formation Factors:
1. Parent material
2. Climate
3. Organisms
4. Topography
5. Time

Memory: CLORPT

## Soil Types:
- Sandy: Large particles, drains fast
- Clay: Small particles, holds water
- Loam: Mix, best for plants
